post_text:
Congratulations to the Fine Arts Department for earning the prestigious 2020 Texas Art Education Association (TAEA) District of Distinction Award!

Edinburg CISD is among only 42 school districts in the state and only two districts in the Rio Grande Valley honored for providing a well-rounded education that advocates and integrates visual arts curriculum to inspire creativity and reach all different learners. #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text: Check out some of the photos from the Linn-San Manuel Veterans Park Groundbreaking Ceremony. The park will be located next to Brewster School. Once completed, children will enjoy a baseball field, a softball field, a basketball pavilion, a walking trail, a concession stand, and a playscape area. Thank you to everyone who made this park a reality for the Brewster School Community! #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

shared_text:
City of Edinburg-Government
September 15 at 2:25 PM ·

FREE COVID-19 Testing in Edinburg!
Dates: Sept. 14-16 & 18-20
Time: 9am-1pm
Location: Richard R. Flores Stadium

REQUIREMENTS:
- MUST HAVE Cell phone for QR access code
- NO symptoms necessary to test
- NO pre-registration required
- PCR test with oral swab done
- For those over 5 years old

post_text:
ECISD Extiende el Programa de Recogida de Comidas en la Acera

El Distrito Escolar de Edinburg ahora ofrece comidas saludables a todos los estudiantes menores de 18 años.

Cada escuela sirve comidas en la acera de lunes a Viernes de 7:30 a.m. a 12:30 p.m., y las rutas de autobús designadas entregarán comidas en la acera de 8:00 a.m. a 12:30 p.m.

Por favor tenga en cuenta que estos horarios y ubicaciones pueden estar sujetos a cambios.

Para obtener una lista de nuestras escuelas en la acera y ubicaciones de rutas de autobús, visite https://www.ecisd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1311649&type=d&pREC_ID=1578044. #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
ECISD Expands Curbside Meal Pickup Program

Edinburg CISD is now offering healthy meals to all children who are 18 years old and younger.

Each campus serves curbside meals Monday – Friday from 7:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m., and designated bus routes will deliver curbside meals from 8:00 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.
Please note these times and locations may be subject to change.

For a list of our curbside campuses and bus route locations, please visit https://www.ecisd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1311649&type=d&pREC_ID=1578044. #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

Thank you to the Hidalgo County Commissioners for recognizing our Curbside Meal Pickup Program with a special resolution today. The resolution honored our child nutrition professionals for their hard work with our summer feeding program.

Since March, the Curbside Meal Pickup Program has served approximately 2.5 million healthy meals to children. #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text: "The Edinburg Consolidated Independent School District Board of Trustees recently approved the budget for the 2020-2021 school year, raising employee salaries while leaving the tax rate unchanged. It marks the ninth consecutive year the Board has increased pay for approximately 4,800 full-time employees." #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD
shared_text:
TEXASBORDERBUSINESS.COM
Edinburg CISD School Board raises salaries 9 years in a row - Texas Border Business
text:
"The Edinburg Consolidated Independent School District Board of Trustees recently approved the budget for the 2020-2021 school year, raising employee salaries while leaving the tax rate unchanged. It marks the ninth consecutive year the Board has increased pay for approximately 4,800 full-time employees." #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

TEXASBORDERBUSINESS.COM
Edinburg CISD School Board raises salaries 9 years in a row - Texas Border Business

post_text: “We just did amazing. We had over 108 sessions with over 10,270 participants with a 91-percent attendance rate,” said ECISD Technology Integration Specialist Gina Alamia. “Thanks to the great work from all of our technology ambassadors and our awesome team, we were able to get ECISD even further along the way in our blended learning experience.” #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD
shared_text:

Edinburg CISD virtual conference attracts thousands of educators, parents - Texas Border Business
text:
“We just did amazing. We had over 108 sessions with over 10,270 participants with a 91-percent attendance rate,” said ECISD Technology Integration Specialist Gina Alamia. “Thanks to the great work from all of our technology ambassadors and our awesome team, we were able to get ECISD even further along the way in our blended learning experience.” #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

TEXASBORDERBUSINESS.COM
Edinburg CISD virtual conference attracts thousands of educators, parents - Texas Border Business

post_text: WOW! This week ECISD had an amazing Ninth Annual Innovate conference! It was the first time that the entire conference was all virtual. There was a huge record number of participants as our educators were able to attend multiple sessions throughout the week and the conference drew more than 11,000 attendees in total. There was almost 110 sessions held. Our hats off to the technology ambassadors from all across the district who worked hand in hand with the technology department to put the conference together. We also want to commend our teachers for engaging in the sessions as everyone works hard to get ready for the 2020-2021 school year! #ECISD #EdinburgCISD #ConnectwithECISD
text: WOW! This week ECISD had an amazing Ninth Annual Innovate conference! It was the first time that the entire conference was all virtual. There was a huge record number of participants as our educators were able to attend multiple sessions throughout the week and the conference drew more than 11,000 attendees in total. There was almost 110 sessions held. Our hats off to the technology ambassadors from all across the district who worked hand in hand with the technology department to put the conference together. We also want to commend our teachers for engaging in the sessions as everyone works hard to get ready for the 2020-2021 school year! #ECISD #EdinburgCISD #ConnectwithECISD

post_text:
The Child Nutrition Department today reached another milestone, serving over 2 million healthy meals to children through the Edinburg CISD Curbside Meal Pickup Program.

Since March 23, our school nutrition professionals have worked hard to provide 2,064,018 meals to feed students in our school community amid the COVID-19 pandemic. ECISD is extending the program until August 21.

The Curbside Meal Pickup Program runs Monday – Friday from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. For a list of distribution sites or to see the weekly menu, visit https://www.ecisd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1311649&type=d&pREC_ID=1578044&fbclid=IwAR3jfLY3JorUo7mtUM_ktPUcQEeB9FwxJb-xuw1Qr0S4seRY6kHA_K4ahII.
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

The following campuses remain closed due to power outages caused by Hurricane Hanna: De Zavala, Gorena, Hargill, Monte Cristo, Truman, and Villarreal.

However, parents can pick up meals at any campus open for distribution.

This fall, the UTRGV Graduate College is making postgraduate education more possible than ever before. They are currently announcing new 100% online graduate programs, scholarships and incentives for anyone interested in pursing a graduate certificate, master’s or doctoral program.

post_text: The Edinburg CISD Board of Trustees and administration are deeply saddened by the passing of Austin Elementary School Principal Homero Cano. Among his many accomplishments, he led his campus to achieve a National Blue Ribbon School Award and was well-respected in our school community. He was an educator for 40 years and with Edinburg CISD for 32 years. Our deepest sympathy and prayers are with his wife, Ernestina Cano, his children, and the entire Cano family.

post_text:
The Edinburg CISD Board of Trustees unanimously approved a resolution today "requesting an order from the Hidalgo County Judge that, until such a time and under circumstances under which it can be scientifically verified that it is safe to return to in-person instruction, all school districts shall remain closed for on-campus, face-to-face instruction for all school age students and shall not reopen for face-to-face instruction until further discussion and a determination that it is safe for students, faculty and staff to return."

To watch the July 15, 2020, Emergency Board Meeting, visit https://video.ibm.com/KATS-EdinburgCISD
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
The Hidalgo County Local Health Authority has issued an order that all schools, from grades pre-kindergarten through grade 12, will not re-open for in-campus instruction until after September 27, 2020.

Edinburg CISD will continue to provide more details on its plans for the upcoming school year and the official start date of schools, so please follow us on social media for updates.

Attached, you will find more information on the order issued by Dr. Ivan Melendez, the Hidalgo County Local Health Authority.
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
This is the district's response to the City of Edinburg's order that was passed today:

"The district agrees with the City of Edinburg's order to require at-home instruction for our students for the upcoming school year.

After listening to the concerns from our Board of Trustees, parents, and staff, the district is focusing on the best way to provide a high-quality level of remote instruction for our students and a safe working environment for our employees.

Interim Superintendent Gilbert Garza Jr. will continue to advocate and partner with local and state officials on the safe reopening of our schools."
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

Edinburg CISD is committed to providing our school community with high-quality educational opportunities and a safe learning and work environment. We continue to closely monitor updates from health and education officials regarding the protocols required for a safe and successful return to instruction and learning in 2020-2021. post_text:
El Programa Transferencia Electrónica de Beneficios durante la Pandemia (P-EBT) es un beneficio para que se entregará una sola vez a las familias que han dejado de tener acceso a comida gratuitas o a bajo costo debido a los cierres recientes de las escuelas. Familias elegibles para el P-EBT van a recibir instrucciones del distrito escolar a fines de mayo en como aplicar. La aplicación de P-EBT estará disponible la primer semana de junio.

Los beneficios de P-EBT son para estudiantes que recibieron beneficios de alimentos SNAP en el mes de marzo 2020 y estudiantes que están certificados para recibir comida gratis o de bajo costo durante el año escolar 2019-2020 en el estado de Texas. Para más información, visíte el sitio: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT.
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.

P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
The Child Nutrition Department today reached a milestone – serving over 1 million healthy meals to children through the ECISD Curbside Meal Pickup Program.

Since March 23, our school nutrition professionals have worked hard to provide 1,014,182 meals to feed students in our school community amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

The Curbside Meal Pickup Program runs Monday – Friday from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. at 31 campuses. For a list of pick up sites or to see the weekly menu, visit https://www.ecisd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1311649&type=d&pREC_ID=1578044
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text: “I’m very excited. I literally cannot wait until my graduation because I really want to go up there,” Garza said. “I was so happy because San Antonio is one of my favorite cities in the world. post_text:
Here's wishing a happy School Lunch Hero Day to all of our staff from the Child Nutrition Department, including the folks who are pictured from Crawford Elementary School.

A reminder that our Edinburg CISD Curbside Meal Pick Up Program is still in operation and will remain open until further notice. The program has distributed approximately 800,000 healthy meals for our children.

The meal services campaign runs Monday – Friday from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. at 31 campuses. If you are looking for a list of pick up sites or want to see the weekly menu, visit https://www.ecisd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1311649&type=d&pREC_ID=1578044
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
Share this special message from our South Middle School Science Department.

Although we are living through a time of “uncertainty” we can be sure of one thing. As REBCAT SCIENTISTS, it is important you understand that the power of our “SCIENTIFIC KNOWLEDGE” has guided us to enable what’s best for humanity and more importantly how it is SCIENCE itself that will get us through these difficult times. COVID-19 has altered the way we are learning, but remember: "THE SPACE BETWEEN US IS KEEPING US SAFE, and we must STAY REBCAT STRONG." The SMS Science Department misses each and every one of you. #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
UPDATE: Edinburg CISD Curbside Meal Pickup Program will be offering additional meals.

Starting on Friday, April 24, students will be able to pick up breakfast and lunch meals for both Friday and Saturday.

Thank you to the staff from the Child Nutrition Department for serving more than 576,000 healthy meals to our children, since the program began on March 23, 2020.

Parents and children are permitted to pick up meals, which is considered allowable travel for essential tasks under the City of Edinburg’s recent Stay Home, Work Safe order.

The meal services campaign runs Monday – Friday from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. at all 31 elementary campuses. If you are looking for a list of pick up sites or want to see the weekly menu, visit https://www.ecisd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1311649&type=d&pREC_ID=1578044
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

Thank you to all of our principals and staff from the Child Nutrition Department for helping to feed our children, including the folks who are pictured from Gorena Elementary School.

The Edinburg CISD Curbside Meal Pick Up Program is still in operation and will remain open until further notice. Parents and children are permitted to pick up meals, which is considered allowable travel for essential tasks under the City of Edinburg’s recent Stay Home, Work Safe order.

The meal services campaign runs Monday – Friday from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. at all 31 elementary campuses. If you are looking for a list of pick up sites or want to see the weekly menu, visit https://www.ecisd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1311649&type=d&pREC_ID=1578044

El virus vive en gotas en los pulmones de personas con COVID-19, y a veces no tienen síntomas. Puedes respirar el mismo aire que cualquiera a 6 pies de ti. Mantente más alejado de las personas durante este tiempo para reducir la posibilidad de respirar el virus. #StayHomeTexas

Para prevenir la propagación de COVID-19 en nuestra comunidad, practique el distanciamiento social:
• Evite salir en público
• Cuando esté en público, mantenga una distancia de seis pies entre usted y los demás.
• Seguir las recomendaciones de los funcionarios locales y estatales.
Obtenga más información en https://texas.gov/covid19
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
UPDATE: Edinburg CISD Curbside Meal Pickup Flexibility Program

In response to new guidelines from the U.S. Department of Agriculture and the Texas Department of Agriculture, parents will be allowed to pick up meals for their children without the child present. However, parents/guardians need to present one of the following:
1. Individual student report cards/Progress reports
2. Student ID cards
3. Birth certificate for children not in school
4. Official letter/email/electronic school application from school listing children enrolled

The meal services campaign runs Monday – Friday from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. at all 31 elementary campuses. If you are looking for a list of pick up sites or want to see the weekly menu, visit https://www.ecisd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1311649&type=d&pREC_ID=1578044
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

Thank you to the staff from the Child Nutrition Department for serving more than 167,000 healthy meals this week to our children! The Edinburg CISD Curbside Meal Pickup Program is still in operation and will remain open until further notice.

Parents and children are permitted to pick up meals, which is considered allowable travel for essential tasks under the City of Edinburg’s recent Stay Home, Work Safe order.

The meal services campaign runs Monday – Friday from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. at all 31 elementary campuses. If you are looking for a list of pick up sites or want to see the weekly menu, visit https://www.ecisd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1311649&type=d&pREC_ID=1578044
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text: Hear members of the Mariachi Oro de Edinburg North High School perform a song on how they are coping with the quarantine. #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD
shared_text:
ENHS Mariachi
March 27 at 6:59 AM ·

Here is what your Mariachi Oro de ENHS had been working on during these quarantine days. Having been inspired by our friends from Roma and McHi, here is our quarantine song.
This song’s original name is “Tu Recuerdo y Yo” by José Alfredo Jimenez. It has been reimagined by Nathan Fernandez with a song title and lyrics:

“La Cuarentena y Yo”

Estoy en el rincón de mi casita
Oyendo a mis hermanos corretear
Me estan volviendo loco, madre mia
Ya déjame salir de este lugar

Yo se que todo el mundo está sufriendo
Y vengo aqui nomas a suplicar
El virus del que hablan es muy feo
Asi que no me toquen que esta mal

Quien no sabe todavía que las manos no se limpian cuando no hay ningun jabón

Quien no llega a la tiendita
Exigiendo su agüita y exigiendo su alcohol
Me estoy aburriendo mas sin mis amigos
Ahorita ya no se si los voy a ver

Ahorita solamente yo les pido
Que se cuiden otra vez, y se bañen bien

Hope you enjoy!
#quarantine #cuarentena #stayathome #virtualmariachi #enhsmariachifamily #lacuarentenayyo

El Programa de Curbside Meals de Edinburg CISD todavía está en funcionamiento y permanecerá abierto hasta nuevo aviso. Los padres y los niños pueden recoger las comidas, lo que se considera un viaje permitido para tareas esenciales bajo la reciente orden Stay in Home, Work Safe de la Ciudad de Edinburg.

La campaña de servicios de comidas se lleva a cabo de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. a 12 p.m. en los 31 campus de primaria. Si está buscando una lista de sitios de recogida o desea ver el menú semanal, visite
https://www.ecisd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1311649&type=d&pREC_ID=1578044.
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
In an emergency meeting with principals and staff, Edinburg CISD Interim Superintendent Gilbert Garza Jr. said Tuesday that all campuses will be closed through April 6.

The Edinburg Consolidated Independent School District announced Tuesday that based on information from the Texas Education Agency (TEA) Commissioner of Education, Hidalgo County government and considerations from health officials regarding coronavirus (COVID-19), school sites will be closed for instruction until Monday, April 6, 2020, pending any additional information and updates.

“I want to thank the community for your patience and cooperation during this time,” said ECISD Interim Superintendent Gilbert Garza Jr. “Edinburg CISD is committed to the continuation of your child’s education.”

For the latest information, visit our website at ecisd.us.
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

Get ready to start being counted on March 12!

For the first time, in 2020 the U.S. Census Bureau will accept responses online. The process will be quick and secure. You can respond to the census in less time than it takes to finish your morning coffee.

You’ll still be able to respond by mail. To learn more about what to expect, visit 2020census.gov. #2020Census #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
Longoria Middle School held the District’s first Stop the Bleed Training for our emergency responders on campus that consisted of some teacher, coaches and administrators.

Participating staff were trained on what to do in the event of trauma that results in bleeding and how to respond to various types of bleeding injuries as well as to learn how to apply pressure on the wound, apply a tourniquet and/or apply wound packing to stop the bleeding.

Uncontrolled bleeding is the number one cause of preventable death from trauma. #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
Check out the Edinburg CISD Technology Interns hard at work, preparing Google Chromebooks.

ECISD recently purchased 2,340 Google Chromebooks for distribution to all secondary campuses. They will be used to enhance student learning.

Before they can be delivered, the Chromebooks must be inventoried, and setup to work within the ECISD WiFi network. To date, ECISD has purchased about 6.000 Chromebooks.
#ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

The Family Career and Community Leaders of America club of Edinburg High School recently competed in Corpus Christi at the Regional Leadership Conference. They worked hard to create their projects and presentations! The students competed in the following categories:

Culinary Arts
Repurpose and Redesign
Public Policy Advocate
Food Innovations
Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation
Sports Nutrition
Promote and Publicize FCCLA

They also took FCSA Tests
(Family Consumer Science Tests) in:

Culinary Arts
Food Science
Hospitality
Interior Design
Step One (a FCCLA leadership based exam)

#ECISD #EdinburgCISD #ConnectwithECISD

post_text:
Check out our CTE Health Science students, who received a
hands-on demonstration of the Da Vinci Surgical System at Edinburg Regional Hospital.

This is a minimally invasive robotic surgical system that uses high-tech instrumentation to make small, precise incisions and operates with pinpoint accuracy.

Benefits for the patients are less bleeding, smaller scars, less pain and discomfort, shorter hospital stay and recovery time. #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD

post_text:
Congratulations to the South Middle School 7th and 8th grade boys cross country teams for winning the District Championships.
The 8th graders never lost a meet, all year bringing home five 1st place trophies.
Placing in the top 20 were the following:
3rd Ethan DeLeon
4th Diego Salinas
8th Jarion Cruz
9th Adan Garcia
10th Sammy Sepulveda
11th Jaxson Shupe
13th Josh Diaz
16th Jayeth Lopez
18th Aiden Lopez
Great Job Rebcats!

The 7th grade team did something that is rarely done in the sport of Cross-Country! They received a perfect score with the 1st place,2nd place,3rd Place, 4th place,5th place winners! Placing in the top 20 were the following:
1st Marcelo Cornett
2nd Sam Maldonaldo
3rd Joel Serna
4th Noah Lopez
5th Jerad Solages
10th JJ Flores
14th Derek Rodriguez
17th Ethan Alvarado
18th Richard Molina
Great Job 7th graders for setting a meet record...WE ARE SOUTH!
#ConnectWithECISD #ECISD #EdinburgCISD

A. Interim Superintendent Gilbert Garza Jr. recognized the Edinburg CISD Board of Trustees in honor of School Board Appreciation Month.

Edinburg Consolidated Independent School District added 59 new photos — at Johnny G. Economedes High School.
December 20, 2019 at 8:46 PM · Cesar Chavez, TX ·

Today a heartwarming event at Economedes HS took place as many campus organizations which included the Migrant Program, Choir, Early College HS Students, Photo Journalism Club, Athletic Trainers, Counselors and others school personnel came together to spread Christmas Cheer! The Migrant Program has been participating in this yearly since it's inception - over the years other clubs/organizations have joined in. There was singing, gift giving and yummy treats! #ECISD #EdinburgCISD #ConnectwithECISD

post_text:
Congratulations to Mike Salinas for being named the new Head Coach for the Javelina Football Team at Texas A&M University - Kingsville. Salinas is a 1995 Edinburg High School graduate, where he was an all-star quarterback.

In 2012, Salinas became the Head Football Coach and Athletics Coordinator at the newly opened Vela High School. We wish Coach Salinas good luck at TAMUK. #ConnectwithECISD #EdinburgCISD #ECISD
